page.title: 08HOMELIFE IN CHITTERNE
page.content: Out of 64 houses in the area, 16 households are retired and 19 households have children under the age of 18 years. Almost every house has a freezer of necessity, the shopping being done once a week. Surplus fruit and vegetables from the gardens are also frozen, and jam making is popular. The majority of households use electricity for cooking, the rest having bottled gas, oil-fired or solid fuel Agas. There is no piped gas. A few people have micro-wave ovens. Many households keep more than one pet; dogs and cats are common. Some residents keep a pony or donkey and others have poultry and small caged animals such as rabbits and guinea pigs.
